snippet: Increased consumer spending may be boosted by strong job growth, but Americans are still choosing to save larger portions of their paychecks.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports that seasonally adjusted retail sales rose 1.2 percent in May 2015, following 0.2 percent gain in April; figures indicate that job growth has begun to lift store sales.
lead_paragraph: Increased consumer spending may be boosted by strong job growth, but Americans are still choosing to save larger portions of their paychecks.

headline.main: Gains in Jobs Pushing Up Retail Sales
headline.print_headline: Gains in Jobs Pushing Up Retail Sales
